snippet: The vehemence of the Tea Party aside, Republican efforts to derail the Affordable Care Act aren’t entirely irrational. It’s a threat to their party.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column contends Republican efforts to derail the Affordable Care Act are not entirely irrational, vehemence of the Tea Party aside; posits the health care law could fundamentally change the relationship between working Americans and their government, posing an existential threat to small-government credo that has defined GOP for four decades.
lead_paragraph: The vehemence of the Tea Party aside, Republican efforts to derail the Affordable Care Act aren’t entirely irrational. It’s a threat to their party.

headline.main: Why the Health Care Law Scares the G.O.P.
headline.print_headline: For G.O.P., Health Care As a Scare

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
